Activity: Arrive, settle in. Enjoy a cup of Earl Grey tea and listen to classical music. Practice a short grounding exercise.
Check the help desk system for updates on the data quality issue, the report generation issue, and any new tickets.

Follow up on the data quality issue reported by @QATEST-1. If @DA-1, @QATEST-2 and @ITPM-1 have identified the root cause, work with them to implement a fix. This may involve correcting the data entry process, updating the data validation rules, or modifying the system's code.
Thoroughly test the solution to the data quality issue to ensure that the data is now being collected and stored correctly.
Once the issue is resolved, update the internal knowledge base with the solution and close the help desk ticket. Notify @QATEST-1 that the issue has been resolved.
Address a new ticket from @TRAINER-1 regarding issues with EHR training materials. It appears there are errors in a section on medication reconciliation.

Review the training materials provided by @TRAINER-1. Identify the specific errors in the medication reconciliation section. This could be a good opportunity to reach out to @RN-3 for clinical insights on the correct process.
Lunch break. Spend some time sketching in my notebook.
Correct the errors in the EHR training materials, working with @RN-3 to ensure accuracy. Provide the updated materials to @TRAINER-1.
Address smaller, quick-fix tickets to keep the queue moving. A printer issue reported by @MRS-1, perhaps.
Dedicate time to reviewing the documentation provided by the EHR vendor (@EHRV-1) to better understand the system's features, functions, and troubleshooting procedures.
Proactively look for potential problems by reviewing system logs and performance metrics. Identify any trends or patterns that may indicate a developing issue.
Continue working on documenting common troubleshooting steps for frequent EHR system issues and data collection problems.
Prepare a summary of the day's activities and plan for tomorrow.
